seriesJson.title: Ways of mankind
seriesJson.description: This series is an exploration into the origin and development of cultures, customs and folkways in various parts of the world.

node.title: You're not alone
node.description: This program, "You're Not Alone," discusses how humans form into groups and the various types of groups that can exist.

node.title: Legend of the longhouse
node.description: "A Legend of the Longhouse" is a study in authority, based on an Iroquois legend.

node.title: Legend of the longhouse
node.description: "A Legend of the Longhouse" is a study in authority, based on an Iroquois legend.

node.title: Sticks and stones
node.description: This program, "Sticks and Stones," discusses the nature of religious belief.

node.title: Case of the sea lion flippers
node.description: This program, "The Case of the Sea-Lion Flippers," discusses ethics among the Yurok people.

node.title: When Greek meets Greek
node.description: This program, "When Greek Meets Greek," discusses ancient Greek values and how they were perpetuated.

node.title: Desert soliloquy
node.description: This program, "Desert Soliliquy," tells the story of a Hopi Indian and the family customs that went into making him who he was.

node.title: Stand in for a murderer
node.description: This program, "Stand in for a Murderer," attempts to show the different ways that cultures deal with issues in order to help listeners understand and respect cultural differences.

node.title: Word in your ear
node.description: This program discusses the vast variety of extant languages, as well as the variables that exist within each language.

node.title: But I know what I like
node.description: "But I Know What I Like" is a study in the arts and how artistic standards vary by culture.
